awd_titl_txt: Fractionation of Rare Earth Elements in Aquatic Geochemical Processes
awd_abstract_narration: .                                                                               J                                                                               H.Laboratory experiments will be performed to determine if and                  how trivalent REE are fractionated during their geochemical                     interactions in waters and sediments.  Field data have shown                    that fractionation occurs during weathering and soil                            development, during early diagenesis of redox.reactive marine                   sediments and in the water column of marine and estuarine                       basins with oxic/anoxic boundaries.  Little is known about the                  reactions and chemical factors which govern fractionation of                    trivalent REE.  Fractionation, in turn, is a unique                             characteristic of REE series and forms the basis for                            understanding geochemical cycling of these important elements.                                                                                                  Emphasis will be placed on developing laboratory simulation of                  natural processes at natural concentrations of solution and                     solid phases.  Radioactive isotopes of REE will be used as                      tracers for the different reactions.
